Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cnd-m3a (Chionodracine analog, synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (95.45%) toKHS-Cnd F1W, Chionodracine analogK: 32%, G: 18%, V=L: 14%.Activity: active against K. pneumoniae KPC (MIC 12.5-25 ug/ml), ESBL E. coli (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), XDR A. baumannii (MIC 3.1-6.25 ug/ml), MDR P. aeruginosa (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), S. aureus MRSA (MIC25-50 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 25 ug/ml), and E. faecalis anti-VRE (MIC 25-50 ug/ml).  In total, 70 clinical strains were tested and the results are expressed as a range.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: it permeated bacterial membranes.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: ~30% hemolysis at 50 uM.Structure:  random coil in both PBS buffer or POPC (1-Palmitoyl-2-oleoyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine) LUVs ((Large Unilamellar Vesicles).
Literature Information.Author: Buonocore F, Picchietti S, Porcelli F, Della Pelle G, Olivieri C, Poerio E, Bugli F, Menchinelli G, Sanguinetti M, Bresciani A, Gennari N, Taddei AR, Fausto AM, Scapigliati G. 2019
Literature Information.Title: Fish-derived antimicrobial peptides: Activity of a chionodracine mutant against bacterial models and human bacterial pathogens.
